intro: Sisyrinchium bermudiana var. mucronatum, commonly known as the Bermuda grass gentian, is a flowering plant native to Bermuda and parts of the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils, thriving in sunny conditions. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its stems are upright and branching. This variety is notable for its ornamental value and its ability to adapt to maritime climates.
